meanings.sent1: The frog had bugeyes that made it easy to spot in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The cartoon character had bugeyes that made him look surprised all the time.
meanings.sent3: The bugeyes of the owl made it seem like it was always watching everything around.
meanings.sent4: Her bugeyes were like two shiny marbles, reflecting the light in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bugeyes of the chameleon helped it see in all directions at once.

meanings.definition: A type of eyewear with large, round lenses
meanings.sent1: She wore bugeyes to protect her eyes from the bright sun at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The comedian put on bugeyes as part of his funny costume.
meanings.sent3: The bugeyes made her look like a quirky scientist from a movie.
meanings.sent4: His bugeyes acted like magnifying glasses, making everything appear larger.
meanings.sent5: The bugeyes were a hit at the costume party, making everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: A type of car headlight with a large, round shape
meanings.sent1: The classic car had bugeyes that gave it a retro look.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic replaced the broken bugeyes with new, shiny ones.
meanings.sent3: The bugeyes of the car looked like big, friendly eyes on the road.
meanings.sent4: The bugeyes of the car lit up the dark street like two bright moons.
meanings.sent5: The bugeyes of the car were so bright that they could be seen from far away.
